title: I'm an on-hit champion
body:
{{champion:145}} I'm an on-hit champion 

{{champion:15}} Ah, so you use your basic attacks to kill enemies?

{{champion:145}} Not exactly - I do a lot of magic damage

{{champion:42}} Ratio problems, I know the feel

{{champion:145}} Well, it's percent health damage

{{champion:81}} So you find yourself some mana issues?

{{champion:145}} What's that? I rush stormrazor.

{{champion:202}} I see you're an artist of some culture as well, and how many shots does your passive stack?

{{champion:145}} Uh, four?

{{champion:202}} Oh, yes.

{{champion:22}} Don't mind him. I'm sure you'll get through the laning phase just fine, though your range leaves something to be desired.

{{champion:145}} Oh, no, my favorite thing is to spam from a sc-

{{champion:96}} Screen away! Just when they think they're safe - SPLAT! You know they used to catch me playing around with trinity force, but now it's "all the rage" - blade! am i right? It's tough for us no mobility carries out here.

{{champion:145}} Hehe, no mobility. Nah, I build strictly AP. I'm an on-hit champion.

> But what she is now build anything you can try to evolve all your skills and do everything ... like come on lol

Imagine if they raised the requirements for the evolved versions to make her choose a build path. That'd be kind of interesting, but they'd have to buff every evolved ability to compensate probably. Though evolved Q seems more like waveclear machine, while evolved W seems like the burstier option, and evolved E seems like the kiting option. She'd also likely need to go attackspeed+AD or attackspeed+AP. meaning she'd always have evolved E.

First neft that is due on her is to make allies unable to apply her plasma stacks. I wouldn't even mind to increase her ults range to whatever the range of her W is for compensation but I'm getting tired of allies being able to hold a champions hand. Synergy is one thing but hitting the great wall of china with a rock from 1 foot away makes it to easy. It started with Yasuo's ult working with any displacement, kept going with reworked Swain's passive working with every hard CC nearby and now we have Kaisa working with every hard CC from one screen away and providing multiple stacks.

When your allies can apply your strongest feature, then there is something wrong. The only champion on which this sort of feature truly worked on so far IMO is Sej because even if she doesn't have to apply the first stack of Permafrost herself it has to be a melee champion with an auto attack which isn't always easy to pull of. And Braum must apply the first stack of his passive himself.

>

The only champion on which this sort of feature truly worked on so far IMO is Sej because even if she doesn't have to apply the first stack of Permafrost herself it has to be a melee champion with an auto attack which isn't always easy to pull of. And Braum must apply the first stack of his passive himself.

I wouldn't say it works on Sej, because it's the reason she's so strong in coordinated play and terrible for solo queue.

You also forgot how Cass's E gets benefits when used on a "Poisoned" target, which includes poisons from Singed, Teemo, and Twitch, and how a champ without a slow who buys Liandry's can benefit from the bonus damage if the target is slowed by a teammate. I don't think the concept itself is problematic, and I don't think it needs to be removed from Kai'Sa. I think she would be a lot more reasonable with number tweaks, like reduced base damages, increased scalings, and allowing her abilities to evolve at numbers other than 100.

I would like to see her passive changed a little bit to make her less of a lane bully, make it kinda like a Braum Passive: Allies can build stacks on enemies but You have to apply stack #1. Maybe change it at level 6 to remove that restriction so you can use your ulti for long range dive/engage like its designed for. Heck maybe even change it so her whole "Allies apply Plasma" effect of her passive is tied to her ultimate, so it won't work until level 6, that way her early game is weaker and you have a greater window to try and put her behind

Quality content right there my good sir. In exchange for the giggles, I present you with my upvote.
